Key Arguments: The government is attempting to suppress freedom of speech.
There is skepticism about who determines what constitutes misinformation and disinformation.
The TGA is criticized for being largely funded by pharmaceutical companies, raising doubts about the accuracy of its information.
The government is accused of manipulating and censoring the media to promote its agenda.
The submission expresses distrust in the government's claims about the COVID-19 vaccine's safety and effectiveness.
The proposed legislation is seen as a means to create another bureaucratic institution and further suppress free speech.
Notable Quotes: Seems to me, our so called, government is hell bent on stopping freedom of speech altogether.
Is deception by omission classed as disinformation?
I am absolutely against it as I am sure it will only be used as a vehicle to create yet another overpaid bureaucratic institution and to further withhold, suppress and censor free speech.
